item.title: Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonColorado Democratic Party was live.Join us with Denver School Board Director Tay Anderson,...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonColorado Democratic Party was live.

Join us with Denver School Board Director Tay Anderson, Senator Michael Bennet, Attorney General Phil Weiser, Representative Leslie Herod and more as we rally voters and volunteers with 24 days left until Election Day!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: However, Anderson said he will push to declare Election Day a...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

However, Anderson said he will push to declare Election Day a holiday in future years.

“I just wanted to make it easier for folks to get out to the ballot box,” he said.

Students and staff at STRIVE Prep’s 11 schools in Denver won’t have school on Nov. 3.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver charter school network gives students and staff Election Day off

Students and staff at STRIVE Prep’s 11 schools in Denver won’t have school on Nov. 3.Students and staff at STRIVE Prep’s 11 schools in Denver won’t have school on Nov. 3.

item.title: What do you gain from sending things like this? I pray for...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

What do you gain from sending things like this?

I pray for everyone that has hate in their heart.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Around a year ago my mother walked into the polls for the first...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Around a year ago my mother walked into the polls for the first time to cast her VERY FIRST ballot for her son.

Now I’m the youngest African-American ever elected to public office in Colorado history.

It’s never too late to go out and #VOTE visit: registermyvote.org
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Folks voting ‘NO’ on the DPS Bond and Mill will further hurt...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Folks voting ‘NO’ on the DPS Bond and Mill will further hurt students.

It will hurt majority students of color, we are looking to put air into schools, bring back comprehensive options to FNE, and looking for funding for nurses and teacher pay.

A ‘NO’ vote is against our children, educators, and community.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I BELIEVE MAIL-IN BALLOTS WORK! I also respect folks right to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I BELIEVE MAIL-IN BALLOTS WORK!

I also respect folks right to decide which style of voting they prefer. I want to ensure that all of #TeamDPS has the ability to cast their ballot as every election is important.

I am looking forward to finding a path forward and making it easier to vote for our parents, educators, and students.

...

P.S. — If Douglas County can make this work, I am sure Denver can as well.

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I have heard feedback from parents since proposing my Election...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I have heard feedback from parents since proposing my Election Day cancellation of school idea, so I would love to hear feedback on proposing a half-day.

Parents can take this time to go vote (WHICH EVERYONE SHOULD DO THEIR MAIL-IN BALLOTS) and then teachers and students can use the afternoon to go vote.

Thoughts?

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: When I am asked what should be done to the West Campus, I will...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

When I am asked what should be done to the West Campus, I will say what I said when I ran for this seat and that is we need to reunify West High School!

Excited to see what student voice has to offer us!

The merger of two Denver schools on the West High campus would represent the second effort underway in the city to restore a shuttered comprehensive high school.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver’s West High is poised to reunify — at students’ request

The merger of two Denver schools on the West High campus would represent the second effort underway in the city to restore a shuttered comprehensive high school.The merger of two Denver schools on the West High campus would represent the second effort underway in the city to restore a shuttered comprehensive high school.

item.title: Excited for my colleague Angela Cobián!
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Excited for my colleague Angela Cobián!

Denver Public Library is with Guadalupe Cobian and 2 others.

With the Latino Awards, we are able to honor the works of Latino community members and the work they've done to improve their communities. Meet the winner of th...e Lena L. Archuleta Community Service Award - Angela Cobián!

Angela Cobián is a first-generation Mexican-American and a first generation college graduate. Ms. Cobián graduated from Colorado College in 2011. During this time she earned the Fred Sonderman Award in Political Science and membership in the Pi Gamma Mu Honors Society.

Following college, Ms. Cobián returned to Denver to teach Literacy for English Language Acquisition-Spanish students in the second and third grade, she also earned a Masters in Curriculum and Instruction from the University of Colorado-Denver. In 2013, she was awarded a Fulbright scholarship to consult with Ensena por Mexico on program development for student-led social change initiatives and to teach English at the National Pedagogical University in Mexico City.

Upon her return from Mexico, Cobián was a Bilingual Community Organizer with Together Colorado, an affiliate of the PICO National Network. She co-led school and congregation-based organizations alongside parents and parishioners addressing immigration and education issues. She continues her work in collective action today as the Director of National Organizing and Development with Leadership for Educational Equity (LEE). The Denver Foundation awarded her the Swanee Hunt Emerging Leader Award in 2017 in recognition of her community work.

Ms. Cobián currently represents District 2 on the Denver Public Schools (DPS) Board of Education. She also serves as Treasurer and Chairperson of the Finance and Audit Committee, and co-led the 2020-21 budget process and COVID-19 response with the DPS Chief Financial Officer.

Ms. Cobián is not only a voice for her constituents, she has used her organizing skills to activate her constituents to be involved in education and elevated their voices in the Denver Public Schools decision-making process.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: BREAKING: The Denver School Board has voted to recognize the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

BREAKING:

The Denver School Board has voted to recognize the Denver School Leaders Association as the official union for school leaders in Denver Public Schools.

My YES vote tonight was for the Black women leaders in DPS that for too long have been underpaid and overlooked.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I am voting NO on the anti-strike clause presented before us in...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I am voting NO on the anti-strike clause presented before us in our School Board meeting. Our school leaders should have the ability to strike if they vote to do so.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Tonight I will cast a YES vote for our school leaders having the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Tonight I will cast a YES vote for our school leaders having the ability to unionize.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

item.author: Tay Anderson
